assessment-question.definition: To what extent does the Member State report the criteria elements required by the 2017 Decision?

answers.option: All elements reported for this criterion
Not all elements reported for this criterion

scoring.option: 76-100% of criteria elements are reported
51-75% of criteria elements are reported
26-50% of criteria elements are reported
1-25% of criteria elements are reported
Not reported

assessment-question.definition: To what extent does the Member State report key aspects of its assessment methodology?

answers.option: All key aspects reported for this criterion
Not all key aspects are reported for this criterion

scoring.option: Key aspects are reported for 76-100% of criteria
Key aspects are reported for 51-75% of criteria
Key aspects are reported for 26-50% of criteria
Key aspects are reported for 1-25% of criteria
Not reported / No assessment aspects satisfied

assessment-question.definition: To what extent is the status assessment of parameters, criteria and elements reported?

answers.option: Parameters, criteria and elements are reported with status assessment for this criterion
Parameters, criteria and elements are not reported with status assessment for this criterion

scoring.option: 76-100% of assessment aspects are assessed
51-75% of assessment aspects are satisfied
26-50% of assessment aspects satisfied
1-25% of assessment aspects satisfied
Not reported/No assessment aspects satisfied

assessment-question.definition: To what extent is the assessment on extent of pressure and impacts reported?

answers.option: Pressures and/or impacts reported for this criterion
Pressures and/or impacts not reported for this criterion

scoring.option: Pressures and impacts reported for 76-100% of the criteria elements
Pressures and impacts reported for 51-75% of the criteria elements
Pressures and impacts reported for 26-50% of the criteria elements
Pressures and impacts reported for 1-25% of the criteria elements
Pressures and impacts reported not reported\not clear

assessment-question.definition: To what extent does the Member State report the same elements as the other countries in the region?

answers.option: Element(s) used for this criterion is/are the same as in most (76%-100%) of the MS in the region
Element(s) used for this criterion is/are the same as in more than half (51-75%) of MS in the region
Element(s) used for this criterion is/are the same as in less than half (26-50%) of MS in the region
Element(s) used for this criterion is/are different from those of the rest of the MS in the region

scoring.option: The MS uses the same elements as most (76%- 100%)of the MS in the region
The MS uses the same elements as more than half (51-75%)of MS in the region
The MS uses the same elements as less then half (26-50%)of MS in the region
The MS uses elements that are different from those of the rest of the MS in the region
Not reported\the information is provided in different formats across MS and it is impossible to compare

The MS uses the same parameters as less then half (26-50%)of MS in the region
The MS uses parameters that are different from those of the rest of the MS in the region

answers.option: The MS reports the same pressures as most (76%- 100%)of the MS in the region

The MS reports the same pressures as less then half
The MS reports pressures that are different from those of the rest of the MS in the region

assessment-question.definition: To what extent does the Member State report the same result and date for GES achievement within the region?

answers.option: The MS uses similar date for achieving GES as most (76%- 100%)of the MS in the region
The MS uses similar date for achieving GES as more than half (51-75%)of MS in the region
The MS uses similar date for achieving GES as less then half (26-50%)of MS in the region
The MS uses different date for achieving GES from those of the rest of the MS in the region

scoring.option: The MS uses similar date (by 2020/after 2020) for achieving GES as most (76%-100%)of the MS in the region
The MS uses similar date (by 2020/after 2020) for achieving GES as more than half (51- 75%)of MS in the region
The MS uses similar date (by 2020/after 2020) for achieving GES as less then half (26-50%)of MS in the region
The MS uses different date (by 2020/after 2020) for achieving GES from those of the rest of the MS in the region
